comment.author: 40003627@N03
comment._content: Thank you for posting and keeping safe these great photographs!!! I love the photographers of old.

comment.author: 87319860@N00
comment._content: Cette photo a beaucoup inspiré les surréalistes : ils y voyaient les prémices des mannequins mystérieux de Giorgio de Chirico. Pour plus d'infos, cf. : Guillaume Le Gall, « Atget, figure réfléchie du surréalisme », Études photographiques, 7 | Mai 2000, [lire en ligne]

comment.author: 79526173@N07
comment._content:
I am about to have an exhibition of paintings and photographs at the Musee de l'Eventail at 2 bvd Strasbourg, opening on 14 May until August 1, so I find it especially apt to see that Atget produced some of his most familiar pictures in this boulevard. Today someone asked me why I was having an exhibition in Paris. What a strange enquiry! Furthermore, my stepfather, Eric Thake with whom I spent a good deal of my childhood and adolescence was one of the most distinguished surrealist painters and woodcut artists in Australia in the second half of the twentieth century.

Peter van Sommers

Peter van Sommers
